intro: Gypsophila spathulifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in a basal rosette, while the stems are usually upright. This species is well adapted to arid and rocky environments, thriving in full sun and well-drained soil. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
